pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:2.1.6: In other words, consent is given for a specific meeting of the Sangha. When the meeting is over—that is, the gathering has left—the consent is no longer valid. See the discussion in Appendix II: Technical Discussion of Individual Bhikkhunī Rules.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc81:2.1.12: The Pali just says dukkaṭa, without specifying that it is an āpatti, “an offense”. Yet elsewhere, such as at Bu Ss 10:2.65, the dukkaṭa is annulled if you commit the full offense of saṅghādisesa. The implication is that in these contexts dukkaṭa should be read as āpatti dukkaṭassa, “an offense of wrong conduct”.
